_exec_summary.SummaryText:
I. Off-site Emergency Response Procedure
 Off-site emergency Response Plan developed and completed jointly by APT Advanced Polymer Technology Corp. (APT) and the Butler County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) addressing the following elements:
 - Pre-emergency planning and coordination with outside parties
 - Personnel roles, line of authority, training and communication
 - Emergency recognition and prevention
 - Safe distances and places of refuge
 - Site security and control
 - Evacuation routes and procedures
 - Decontamination
 - Emergency alerting and response procedures

II. Regulated Substance handled
 - Manufacturing of coatings
 - TDI used to produce coating
 - Quantities stored up to 45000 lbs

III. Release Scenarios
 A. Worst-case Scenario
 Worst-case release scenario analysis previously being performed by the Butler County Local Emergency Planning Committee.  Information is included in APT Advanced Polymer Technology Corporation's Off-Site Response Plan.  Distance to endpoint and off-site receptors provided in Section 2 Toxics: Worst Case.
 B. Alternative Release Scenarios
 Alternative release scenarios performed by Baker Environmental, Inc. Coraopolis, PA
 Release of liquid TDI from hole in tank: no off-site consequences anticipated
 Release of liquid TDI from hole in pipe: no off-site consequences anticipated

IV. General Accident Release Prevention Program
 - Emergency Response Training for employees including refresher
 - Safe TDI-handling training provided by TDI-suppliers
 - General employee training governed by ISO 9001 certified procedures
 - Documentation Control governed by ISO 9001 management system
 - Preventive Maintenance Program governed by ISO 9001 management system
 - Tank and equipment inspections
 - APT Preparedness, Prevention and Contingency (PPC) Plan

V. Five Year Accident History
 No reportable accidents in the past five years.

VI. Preparedness, Prevention and Contingency (PPC) Plan
 PPC Plan designed to integrate elemen

ts of the following required plans:
 - Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasure (SPCC) Plan
 - Spill Response Plan (SPR)
 - Emergency Action Plan
